summary: This document is an email chain from September 2021 regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial discovery process. An FBI Victim Services Program Manager requests information on communications with victims, witnesses, or their attorneys for the upcoming trial. A Victim Specialist from the Los Angeles Field Office responds, identifying attorney Gloria Allred and mentioning two other victims.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Identified by an FBI Victim Specialist as an attorney for victims in the Epstein/Maxwell case, with whom communications were had.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the New York investigation (case 50D-NY-3027571) that is scheduled for trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a co-defendant with Jeffrey Epstein in the New York investigation that is scheduled for trial.

connections.description: Gloria Allred is identified as an attorney for victims in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
Both are named as subjects of the same New York criminal investigation and scheduled trial.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Date
events.description: The trial for the New York investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin.

events.title: Discovery Request Issued
events.description: An FBI Program Manager sends an urgent request for all communications with victims, witnesses, or their attorneys to be provided for criminal discovery.

events.title: Discovery Deadline
events.description: The deadline for FBI Victim Specialists to provide requested communication details for the Maxwell trial discovery.

keyFacts: The Ghislaine Maxwell trial was scheduled for November 29, 2021, under case number 50D-NY-3027571.
The FBI Victim Services Division was actively gathering all communications (texts, emails, voicemails) with victims, witnesses, and their attorneys for discovery purposes ahead of the trial.
Attorney Gloria Allred is explicitly named as having been communicated with regarding victims in the case.
An FBI Victim Specialist from Los Angeles confirmed contact with Allred and two other unnamed victims.
The document highlights the procedural steps and tight deadlines involved in pre-trial discovery for a high-profile federal case.
